result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin W. Gullo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 237 days, if revoked.
Court requests the DOC assign a PO Agent who specializes in mental health to the DE.
Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
* Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD    plus surcharges.   State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine.
May not have contact with Richard Fogle, James McMillan, Marissa Gomez, 521 59th Street Kenosha, 6128 7th Avenue Kenosha, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Completion of Representation
Submitted by Atty Joseph Corcoran
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

8:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin W. Gullo in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Justin W. Gullo. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF172/22CF209/22CM160. Victim rights compliance. Matters are resolved and agreement is placed on the record.

22CF172: State amends count 1 to misdemeanor 943.01(1) - Criminal Damage to Property and amended information is filed. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to amended count 1; found guilty by the court. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 30 days KCJ conditional jail. No contact with 6128 7th Avenue Kenosha WI, 521 59th Street Kenosha WI, Richard F., James M. and Marissa G.. State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court requests the DOC assign a PO Agent who specializes in mental health to the DE. 237 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant in case 22CF209.

22CF209: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1, 3 & 4 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 30 days KCJ conditional jail. No contact with 6128 7th Avenue Kenosha WI, 521 59th Street Kenosha WI, Richard F., James M. and Marissa G.. State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court requests the DOC assign a PO Agent who specializes in mental health to the DE. 235 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant in case 22CF209.

22CM160: Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 30 days KCJ conditional jail. No contact with 6128 7th Avenue Kenosha WI, 521 59th Street Kenosha WI, Richard F., James M. and Marissa G.. State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court requests the DOC assign a PO Agent who specializes in mental health to the DE. 237 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant in case 22CF209.
